author: Shubham Kumar
title: Boston Dynamics & Toyota Join Forces to Advance Humanoid Robots
text: Boston Dynamics and Toyota Research Institute (TRI) have announced a strategic partnership to accelerate the development of human robots. This collaboration aims to accelerate the development of humanoid robots by using Boston Dynamic's Advanced humanoid platform, Atlas, and TRI's pioneering work in the Large Behaviour Model (LBM). By pooling their resources, Boston Dynamics and TRI aim to create humanoid robots that can easily handle complex tasks and adapt to their surroundings. This not only has the potential to revolutionize several industries but also to improve efficiency and safety in these sectors significantly. Revolutionizing Humanoid Robotics [Boston Dynamics](https://bostondynamics.com/atlas/), known for its exceptional progress in robotic mobility, has developed one of the most advanced humanoid robots, Atlas, with advanced flexibility and movement. However, the hardware has evolved significantly, and the software required to enable Atlas to communicate with its surroundings still presents challenges. This is where Toyota's expertise in AI comes into play. TRI's LBM allows robots to learn and adapt autonomously by simulating millions of task variations. This is done the same way LLMs like [ChatGPT](/article/chatgpt-loses-best-voice-scarlett-johansson) learn to understand and generate human language. By integrating this technology into Atlas, Boston Dynamics plans to develop strong, mobile, intelligent robots that are capable of multitasking in real-world conditions. Potential Applications and Challenges The collaboration between Boston Dynamics and TRI can potentially transform several sectors, including manufacturing and elder care. Toyota's interest in using [AI-powered robots](/article/robots-powered-by-soft-skills-could-apparently-be-future-business-leaders) on manufacturing lines to replace hazardous and repetitive jobs is just the beginning. The partnership also envisions robots assisting with everyday tasks and elderly care in households, demonstrating the vast potential of robotics to enhance our quality of life. While the partnership between Boston Dynamics and TRI holds promise for improving our lives, it's important to acknowledge the challenges that come with it. Despite the potential benefits, issues such as cost, safety, and ethical considerations need to be carefully navigated. This awareness is crucial for the responsible development and deployment of advanced humanoid robots. The Future of Advanced Humanoid Robots These organizations working together marks a vital milestone, but making humanoid robots ready for commercial use is still some years away. However, the combined expertise of Boston Dynamics in robotic hardware and TRI in AI can potentially revolutionize the robotics industry. By creating intelligent and autonomous machines, the partnership could significantly advance the field of robotics, opening up new possibilities for human-robot interaction and applications in various industries.

author: Peter Tchernokojev
title: Trabajadoras de escoletas externalizadas exigen sueldos justos y equitativos
text:
Trabajadoras de escoletas externalizadas exigen sueldos justos y equitativos
Piden al Ayuntamiento de Palma igualdad de condiciones con las empleadas de gestión directa
Palma
Un grupo de trabajadoras de las escoletas de gestión externa del Ayuntamiento de Palma ha intervenido este jueves al mediodía en el pleno municipal para reivindicar la mejora de sus condiciones laborales y salariales. Continúan con sus protestas debido a la gran diferencia de sueldos entre quienes trabajan en escoletas de gestión directa municipal y aquellas que forman parte de una subcontrata. Se trata de una diferencia salarial de unos 700 euros mensuales por la misma categoría profesional.
Mercedes Leo, una de las trabajadoras afectadas, denuncia que cobran el salario mínimo interprofesional y asegura que todas tienen titulaciones, están en formación continua y que esta situación no se tiene en cuenta. Calculan que son unas 130 las trabajadoras afectadas.
Más información
La red pública de escoletas de Palma está compuesta por 11 centros, de los cuales 3 son gestionados directamente por el Ayuntamiento, mientras que los 8 restantes dependen de empresas privadas mediante una subcontrata. Esto genera, según las trabajadoras, una discriminación laboral, ya que desempeñan las mismas funciones que sus compañeras del sector público, pero con un salario mucho menor.
Desde hace tres meses, las trabajadoras han intentado entablar un diálogo con el Ayuntamiento para exponer su situación y encontrar una solución, pero hasta el momento no han obtenido respuesta. Denuncian que, aunque todas siguen las directrices marcadas por la Conselleria de Educación, no cuentan con las mismas condiciones laborales.
Insisten en que, si todas realizan las mismas funciones y les exigen las mismas titulaciones, deberían tener el mismo sueldo.
Las trabajadoras exigen al Ayuntamiento que atienda sus demandas y garantice una igualdad salarial entre todo el personal que trabaja en las escoletas públicas.

author: Laura McQuarrie
title: AI Loyalty Program Agents - AI-powered Loyalty Platform Antavo Turned a Model Employee Into Timi AI (TrendHunter.com)
text:
During its 2024 Keynote, AI-powered loyalty platform Antavo launched Timi AI, a first-of-its-kind AI agent based on the company's senior business analyst, Timi Garai. Launching as part of Antavo's Loyalty Planner, Timi AI equips clients with their own loyalty assistant in over 80 languages, built on Garai's decades of loyalty expertise and experience.
With Timi AI, Antavo's clients are supported through every stage of loyalty program development via real-time on-demand video chats with the avatar. "Our creation of an AI agent based on a colleague is a world-first for the loyalty industry and a secret weapon for programme developers, as they no longer have to wait years to make changes," said co-founder and CEO Attila Kecsmar.
AI-powered Loyalty Platform Antavo Turned a Model Employee Into Timi AI
[Laura McQuarrie](/LauraMcQuarrie)— October 17, 2024 —

author: Joe Lombardi
title: RFK Jr. To Eliminate 10,000 Health Jobs, Close Offices: Report
text:
The planned changes involve the elimination of 10,000 full-time positions across various departments responsible for critical functions such as disease outbreak response, insurance provision for low-income Americans, and drug approval, according to the story published Thursday morning, March 27.
If enacted, these measures would result in the department losing nearly one-quarter of its personnel, reducing the total workforce to approximately 62,000 federal health workers, the report said, noting that the department will close five of its 10 regional offices.
Click here to read the complete Wall Street Journal report.
